title: Multi-scale Correlative Workflows, Challenges and Opportunities for Cryo CLEM
content: Despite the established role of Electron Microscopy (EM) in life science research, revealing extensive subcellular information in exquisite detail, EM has limitations: the loss of 3D context, necessity for demanding sample preparation protocols with introduction of artefacts and limited field of view when compared to other imaging formats, e.g., light microscopy or X-ray microscopy. These limitations risk: “missing” rare ultrastructural events through the limited volumes of tissue examined which are further compounded by challenges extrapolating 3D information from 2D images and then understanding ultrastructural changes with respect to cell function.
